Property description
Fabulous townhouse within south central location.

Description

63 Aberdeen Avenue is a contemporary styled and well-proportioned modern townhouse constructed in 2011 of buff brick elevations with full height glazing and forms part of this sought after South City location off Brooklands Avenue.

The property which extends to 2,644 sq ft (246.6 sq m) over four floors and has very well planned flexible and largely open plan living accommodation especially at first floor, is end of terrace which as a result also has glazing to the side elevation which allows additional light to enter.

The property is situated adjacent to Lennox Walk and has angled views onto Aberdeen Square a large grassed public square. At ground floor is a sizeable kitchen, dining and family room fitted with a comprehensive range of high gloss cabinetry with granite working surfaces, double sink and integrated Siemens appliances including five burner gas hob, dishwasher and a large fridge/freezer. This space is divided up into areas of tiled and oak flooring and is fully glazed to the front looking onto the Aberdeen Avenue tree belt. There is a good-sized utility room to the rear with a further one and a half bowl sink & drainer and spaces for washing machine and tumble dryer.

At first floor is a long open plan triple aspect reception space which is currently arranged into three separate zones. The front area is a more informal snug sitting area with a large picture window to the front and has a feature gas pebble fireplace however this could equally be used as a formal dining area. The central space is currently used as a dining and occasional work & study space. To the rear is the large full width reception space fully glazed with bi-parting sliding doors to the particularly impressive and well laid out main terrace which has brick walls and plenty of space for relaxing, entertaining and alfresco dining. There is oak flooring to the whole of this floor which also includes a large landing space currently used as a library area.

The two upper floors are carpeted and comprise four bedrooms. The second floor has two very large doubles, one overlooking the tree belt to the front and the other has wall to wall wardrobes and an en suite shower room, this along with the other rear bedroom has access to a full width balcony overlooking the main terrace below. Another large landing area to the front with dual aspect glazing which can be used as a further work & study space plus a large family bathroom, fully tiled with Villeroy and boch sanitaryware, as all bathrooms in the house, completes this floor.

The principle bedroom suite occupies the whole of the top floor and is substantial. The main bedroom area is to the front and has a further sitting area with L shaped full height and width glazing to two sides of the large terrace which has super elevated views into the tree belt and Aberdeen Square. To the rear is a spacious walk in dressing area with wall to wall hanging rails and the en suite bathroom with both separate shower and bath.

Below the main terrace, accessed internally from the hallway, or by the covered shared car access (via an electric vehicle gate at the other end of the terrace) and by the pedestrian gates is the private garage area with ample space for 2 cars, numerous bicycles/scooters etc. and further storage. In addition to this private garage parking there is a residents parking scheme in operation with resident and visitor permits available from Cambridge City Council at modest annual cost.

The property which has wet gas fired underfloor heating throughout, with additional heated towel rails in the bathrooms, plus mains pressure hot water, via an upgraded boiler & cylinder, can be seen in greater detail on the attached floor plan.

Location

Aberdeen Avenue is situated within the award winning Accordia development just off Brooklands Avenue and within very easy reach of Cambridge Railway Station with services to London from 50 minutes.

The Cambridge University Botanic Garden, a 40 acre heritage garden with glasshouses and a popular Café is just 0.5 miles away.

There are independent schools such as The Leys, St Faiths, Stephen Perse and St Mary plus State schools for all ages including Hills Road Sixth Form College.

Excellent shopping & entertainment facilities and cultural amenities are available in the historic centre of the city including a busy daily market, the Grand Arcade shopping mall and an art house cinema. Further mini-market shopping and other entertainment facilities are available at the end of Brooklands Avenue, around the station and in the adjacent Cambridge Leisure complex which includes a multiscreen cinema, bowling alley and live music, comedy & theatre venue The Junction.

All distances and times are approximate.

Square Footage: 2,644 sq ft



Directions

From London, heading north along the M11, exit at junction 11 and proceed through Trumpington into Cambridge. Once on Trumpington Road bear right at the main junction onto Brooklands Avenue. Take the first right hand turn into Aberdeen Avenue, the property is the last house on the left opposite the mature tree belt.

Address: Lower End, Swaffham Prior, Cambridge, Cambridgeshire, CB25
Description:
Property description
Guide Price: £1.65m - £1.8m

Accessed through private gates, a large sweeping driveway leads you to this quite magnificent four-bedroom Grade 2 listed period home, sitting on a grand plot in the region of two acres, dating back to the 14th Century with later additions, sympathetically extended on at least three occasions to its current incarnation as a substantial and delightful country family home which the current vendors describe as inviting and very spacious, offering plenty of light throughout whilst maintaining a very private position.

Guide Price: £1.65m - £1.8m

Cloaked in history , of which has been fully documented in a new and professionally written book, this property was originally a Medieval Hall House with its history evidenced throughout with original architecture and character with numerous exposed beams, with some featuring the original trusses and carpenter’s marks, as well as some stunning brick fireplaces, which collectively bring a sense of warmth.

The property has a much larger than typical drive, space for 20 - 25 cars and very easy access for deliveries, leading to the main house to the side, with the grounds outside not only backing onto green space but also providing secluded private gardens with mature and colourful shrubbery, trees, inviting patios and BBQ cooking area, a large lawn, and wood stores; making this a fabulous family-friendly outside retreat and perfect for entertaining. Not forgetting this home enjoys its own orchard to the rear and is even visited by deer often that roam the garden.

The accommodation briefly comprises of an Entrance Hallway, Drawing Room, Sitting Room, Dining Room, Study, four impressive character Bedrooms, two Bathrooms, fully connected Infinity Broadband, as well as boasting a Barn Garage for three to four cars with power, and permissions in place to convert to an annexe/living quarters as well as permission to build another studio annexe plus internal house alterations. (See planning app 18/00170/LBC). All of which is perfectly located within close proximity to the schools, playground, and village public house.

Surrounded by beautiful countryside the property is close by to Devil’s Dyke, a linear earthwork from Saxon times and a popular walk connecting the delightful villages of Reach and Wood Ditton, and with additional quite wonderful walks to Great Wilbraham and Fordham, with country pubs, many offering fabulous food, aplenty.

Further local popular walks are to be found in the stunning grounds of Anglesey Abbey, on Newmarket Heath, and Wicken Fen. For cyclists, avoid the roads and enjoy the 25-mile Cambridge to Ely National Cycle route which can be joined two kilometres beyond the village.

There is a fabulous Farm Shop within 5 minutes walk Snake Farm with local produce, local groceries are a 15 minutes cycle to Swaffham Bulbeck, and there is even an Old Mill baking in the village where you can buy flour. Additionally, just 4km away in Burwell you have a local independent Coffee Shop and a Fuel Station with a Co-op .

For entertainment, there is historic Cambridge, Ely with its brand new Multi-Plex Cinema, Newmarket, and Bury St Edmunds all offering a huge diversity of arts (museums, thriving music venues, mainstream and arthouse cinemas, and historic theatres) sports venues, and facilities including the two wonderful Race course at the ‘home of racing’, buoyant city centres for shopping and a choice of dining from Michelin starred restaurants to cosy gastropubs and a wide variety of cuisines from around the world.

There is a great golf course at Newmarket, Quy Mill Gym and swimming pool, a 5-minute drive away, and fantastic Kayaking at the River Cam at Upware 5 miles away, great also for paddling and various other water activities.

Train links from Cambridge and Cambridge North bring the West End and the City of London within easy reach, and direct links from Cambridge take you to Stansted and Gatwick Airports.

Finally, whilst Cambridge is world-famous for its University, education needs from nursery upwards are served to a high standard by great local schools feeding outstanding Sixth Form Colleges in the state sector and a plethora of highly regarded private schools within a short drive to Ely, Newmarket, and Cambridge.

Property description
A rare opportunity to acquire a cul-de-sac building plot in one of the most highly regarded and desirable areas of Cambridge, with full planning permission in place to create a substantial and contemporary detached house that opens onto a south facing back garden, to sit as neighbour to an existing well presented, 4 bedroom house, at number 6 Pearce Close, with its own planning in place for a rear extension and remodelling.

Cambridge City Centre 1 mile, M11 (junction 12) 1.25 miles, Mainline Railway Station (King’s Cross and Liverpool Street lines) 2 miles, (distances are approximate).

An incredibly rare development opportunity in this coveted city location, the site offers prospective purchasers the chance to acquire an existing detached property with scope for improvement as well as a generous plot with full planning given to create a second substantial property.

The existing house, 6 Pearce Close, originally dates from 1983 and is constructed with brick elevations under a tiled roof. Internally, the property offers 1,356 sq ft (126 sq m) of spacious and versatile accommodation arranged over 2 floors, which enjoys a light and airy feel throughout. The property further benefits from approved planning permission to demolish and rebuild the kitchen/dining room to create a further 108 sq ft of living space.

The plot which will home number 7 is situated at the end of a no through road and will be the natural focal point upon entry to Pearce Close. Measuring 0.06 of an acre (0.024 hectares), the plot has the fantastic benefit of having full planning permission in place to build a 3 storey detached house which affords the eventual purchaser the luxury of being able to "self-build" the property and choose the final specification and finish that they desire. Copies of the planning permissions (Ref: 20/04715/FUL) are available via Great Cambridge Shared Planning website and following the planning link.

This opportunity provides a number of options to the owner of 6 & 7 including the convenience of living in number 6 during the construction of the new property at number 7, coupled with the subsequent benefit of having a potential rental income on one or other of the properties. Alternatively, the plot of land at number 7 could be incorporated into the plot of number 6 to enhance the size of the garden alongside considerably improving and extending the existing house.

Pearce Close lies within the highly regarded Newnham area, which is widely recognised as one of the best residential locations in the city. Local facilities include a post office, chemist, bakers, butchers, grocers, small supermarket and the highly regarded Newnham Croft Primary School. The newly improved Penarth Place Play Area is just 250 meters away and Lammas Land Recreation Ground, with a large children’s play area, tennis court and paddling pool, is within half a mile. The historic city centre is about 1 mile away, providing an attractive combination of ancient and modern buildings, colleges, winding lanes, the tree lined River Cam and an extensive range of shopping facilities. The property is also extremely well placed for many of the colleges, University departments, “The Backs” and delightful walks along the river to the nearby village of Grantchester. An excellent range of schools for all ages are within half or three quarters of a mile including St John’s, King’s, The Leys, Stephen Perse, Hills Road Sixth Form College, St Mary’s and Newnham Croft. For the sport enthusiasts, the Cocks and Hens Tennis Club, with its 8 floodlit courts, 2 grass courts and clubhouse, is only a short distance away.

Property description
• 135 Station Road, Histon, Cambridge, CB24 9NP
• 5,933 sq ft / 551.29 sq m
• Substantial Period Office Building
• Excellent Local Transport Links
• Site Area 0.44 / 0.18 hectares
• Opposite the Entrance to Vision Park
• Guide Price: £1,600,000

The Property comprises two elements: a former detached two storey dwelling that has been converted into office accommodation ('The Red House') and a single storey warehouse to the rear, situated on a self-contained site with yard / car parking space. The building is a local landmark of historical significance and originally the family home of Chivers jam, whose products are still locally produced and shipped around the world.

The front part of the site is occupied by The Red House which is an attractive building of solid brick construction under a pitched tiled roof and with two large bay windows to the front elevation. The windows have recently been replaced with solid hardwood, double glazed windows. There is a kitchen area and WC. Character features have been retained including high ceilings of approximately 3 metres to both ground and first floor.

To the rear of The Red House there is a garden area and a warehouse which has solid brick elevations under a corrugated roof covering. This is adjoined to The Red House and comprises office / ancillary accommodation, a boiler room, kitchen, stores and WCs.

The Property is located in the village of Histon which lies approximately 3 miles north of Cambridge city centre. Histon is connected to its neighbouring village of Impington and provides range of local facilities. The Property is situated in an established commercial location opposite Vision Park, an office development with occupiers including Santander, Regus and AX Intelligence.

The Property benefits from good transport links, situated 0.2 miles north of the Guided Busway which provides a fast and frequent service to Cambridge North railway station (6 minutes) and Cambridge city centre (16 minutes) as well as St Ives and Huntingdon. Cambridge North railway station, approximately 3.5 miles south east of the Property, provides a direct service to London Kings Cross. There is also a bus stop immediately to the front of the Property on Station Road, providing services to Cottenham in the north and to Cambridge in the south.

Property description
Hockeys is proud to present this stunning five-bedroom, detached home on Marion Close, CB3, with its country lane feel described as an oasis in the heart of the city.
The current owners have brought this property up to an immaculate standard, creating a spacious yet homely property, offering a private wine cellar, a heated outside swimming pool and an open plan kitchen/diner; modern living at its finest. The property was built in 1958 and spans over an impressive 2700sq. ft, with the surrounding land protected from further development.
With solid oak doors to the majority of the ground floor presenting an impressively modern yet subtle aesthetic, the property comprises a large, L-shaped living space with log fire, currently split into a separate snug/music room, and a downstairs WC accessed from the entrance hall. The open-plan kitchen/diner is finished to a high specification with composite stone countertops. An induction hob with double oven is provided along with two warming drawers, an inset stainless steel sink with extending hose and plenty of storage. There is space for a large free-standing fridge-freezer unit as well as an island, complete with breakfast bar and a secondary sink unit. The ground floor additionally provides the perfect work-from-home space with a large study, finished with a set of Velux windows providing natural lighting. One of the bedrooms is found on the ground floor with its own shower room, as well as access to the rear of the property, next to the utility room with further integrated storage space, space for washing appliances and stainless steel sink with extending hose.

The first floor comprises four more bedrooms, integrated storage is provided within all. The master bedroom is of a fantastic size, finished with exposed floorboards, offering a dressing area and an en-suite bathroom complete with WC, wash basin, bath and a full-sized shower. There is also a family bathroom and a separate WC on the first floor, finished with marble tiling. The main loft is boarded with lighting.
There is a combination of radiators and underfloor heating throughout.

The driveway is gravelled and a large garage with electric door is provided; within this is the underground, spiral-styled wine cellar.
The front garden is laid to lawn and features various shrubs and bushes. There is space to park 4+ bicycles to the side of the property. It is an easy cycle to either Cambridge City or Cambridge North train station (about 15mins each).

The rear garden provides a patio terrace with another grass area beyond the all-year-round swimming pool, which features a swim jet, underwater lighting and an electric, retractable safety cover and its own heating system. Also included is a log shed and watering system for plants.


EPC Rating: D

Property description
VIRTUAL VIEWING AVAILABLE ON THIS HOME
A stunning, contemporary family house with stylish and beautifully maintained accommodation, situated in a highly convenient location on the south side of the city within half a mile of Addenbrooke's Hospital/Biomedical Campus.

Cambridge City Centre and Mainline Railway Station 1.75 miles, M11 (Junction 11 1.5 miles), Addenbrooke's Hospital/Biomedical Campus 0.5 of a mile, Stansted Airport 27 miles, M25 38 miles (distances are approximate).

This outstanding, contemporary townhouse offers stunning accommodation over three floors and provides excellent versatility suitable for a variety of needs. The internal finish is stylish and beautifully presented and the well proportioned rooms, with exceptionally high ceilings and large deep glazed windows, are flooded with natural light, due to the property’s southerly aspect.

Built in 2014 by Countryside Properties who, wherever possible, use viable, renewable, sustainable or recyclable resources in the construction of their homes, the property was formerly known as “The Hoffman” house type, being one of a limited number from the highly successful “Mansion” collection. Incorporating the latest 21st century technology, the property has also been designed with energy efficiency in mind and incorporates many energy saving features.




Northrop Road is situated within the highly acclaimed Aura development, which forms part of the unique suburb on the south side of Cambridge known as Great Kneighton. Facilities will include a central community square, excellent range of shops, primary and secondary school education, library, doctor's surgery and dentistry practice, together with large open spaces including a 120 acre nature reserve, allotments, footpaths, sports pitches, cycling tracks and a BMX course.

Cambridge City Centre with its attractive combination of ancient and modern buildings, colleges, winding lanes and excellent shopping facilities, is easily accessible by bicycle or the Cambridge Guided Busway, which also connects with Addenbrooke's Hospital/Biomedical Campus, Cambridge Science Park, St Ives and Huntingdon. The property is also extremely well placed for access to a number of excellent state and independent schools, Sixth Form Colleges in Long Road and Hills Road, the M11 for Stansted Airport and London and a mainline railway station with services to King's Cross and Liverpool Street in 52 minutes and 67 minutes respectively.

38 Northrop Road enjoys an excellent position on the western side of the development, screened to the front by established trees and benefiting from a southerly aspect to the rear.

Property description
Secluded, single storey dwelling, situated in this much sought-after private road within the village of Great Shelford, upon a mature plot of circa 0.42 acre.

- Cambridge Bio-Medical Campus - approx. 2.7 miles
- Cambridge Railway Station - approx. 4.2 miles

• 2/3 Bedrooms
• Spacious sitting room
• Dining room
• Study
• Potential for redevelopment / extension
• Driveway parking
• Garage & workshop
• Large mature grounds
• Swimming pool
• EPC rating F

Great Shelford is a highly regarded village, just a short distance from Cambridge city centre and the largest centre of medical research and health science in Europe, Cambridge Biomedical Campus. It is also convenient for Babraham Institute, Genome Campus at Hinxton, Granta Park and Chesterford Park. There are a wide range of local amenities including local butchers, bakers, Shelford delicatessen, chemist, public houses, coffee shops and a restaurant in the village.

32 Coppice Avenue sits well back behind a generous driveway and garden to the front, and a large mature garden to the rear. The property offers well-proportioned accommodation throughout, and large picture windows and glazed doors provide an abundance of natural light to all principal rooms.

The sitting room is a particularly generous space, and two large picture windows provide beautiful views over the mature rear gardens. There are two further reception spaces across the rear of the property; a study which also overlooks the rear garden, and a large dual aspect dining room which opens into the garden and links with the kitchen. The kitchen has been recently re-fitted with contemporary light grey cabinetry and includes a range of integrated Bosch appliances.

There are two double bedrooms to the front of the property. Both bedrooms are of generous proportions, and each is fitted with a range of built-in wardrobes. The smaller of the two bedrooms also benefits from a dual aspect and fitted hand wash basin and vanity unit.

There is also a guest cloakroom and a large family bathroom which includes both a separate shower and bath, utility room with side access door and a range of built-in cupboards which provide plentiful storage space.

Outside, the front driveway is bordered with mature hedging, trees and beautifully planted beds and provides ample off-street parking. The rear gardens are well stocked with mature shrubs and trees and provide a secluded outdoor space which is subtly partitioned into three sections including the terrace and pool, the central lawn, and a kitchen garden to the rear. Beyond the garden is a large expanse of greenbelt farmland and a wooded area beyond.

Property description
A modern home on an award winning development.

Description

14 Henslow Mews is a contemporary, semi-detached townhouse constructed of buff brick elevations with high specification double glazed windows and doors. Owned since 2013 the property has had several improvements which were overseen by the current owners.

The house which extends to approximately 2,275 sq ft over four floors is being sold with no upward chain and can be seen in greater detail on the attached floorplan.

14 Henslow Mews is located on a quiet part of the award winning Accordia development with very little vehicular traffic and views not only over an attractive belt of trees and pretty houses beyond but easy access to some of the communal gardens. In our view this is one of the most attractive positions on Accordia.

Accessed from the front door one is immediately struck by the quality and care of the property. To the right is an exceptional kitchen breakfast room with Amtico wood flooring and a fully fitted Nicholas Anthony kitchen with Siemens appliances including two ovens (one with a microwave function), hob with hidden extractor and dishwasher. This wonderful space is enhanced with views over the communal gardens from floor to ceiling windows.

There is a WC and separate utility room with a washing machine and tumble drier. At the end of the hall there is access to the garage and due to its position at the end of the row of properties is also afforded an additional space if required.

At first floor level there is a triple aspect open plan sitting, dining and family room with remote controlled gas fire and wood flooring which enjoys a wooded outlook through the large picture windows to the front. To the rear, sliding doors access an exceptional terrace with attractive tiles and raised beds with a watering system.

The bathrooms have all been fitted with contemporary Villeroy & Boch sanitaryware with Hansgrohe mixer taps and shower control and limestone tiled floors. Both the main bedroom and guest bedroom have en suite showers, and the family bathroom, found on the second floor, benefits from a bath. The principal bedroom on the top floor has a dressing area and has access to a terrace to the front and a wide balcony with good views to the rear.

Agents note – please note that the current owners configured what were previously two bedrooms into one (bedroom three). The option to re-convert back to two bedrooms is available to new owners.

Location

Henslow Mews is in a prime location with The Botanical Gardens, open spaces of Lammas land and Coe Fen and the historic city core all within approximately a mile.

Independent schools such as The Leys, St Faiths, Stephen Perse and St Mary’s along with Hills Road Sixth Form College are all nearby. State schooling for all age groups is also available in the City.

For the commuter, Cambridge railway station has fast and regular services to both London’s Kings Cross and Liverpool Street stations from around 48 minutes.

Excellent shopping facilities and cultural amenities are available in the historic core of the city including a busy market square that dates back several centuries and the Grand Arcade shopping mall.

Locally, Cambridge Leisure is a large complex offering a multi-screen cinema, several restaurants, a live music venue and several supermarkets.

All distances and times are approximate.

Square Footage: 2,275 sq ft

What is a Custom Build Home?

Custom build homes are a new form of buying a house that enables you to design and create your new home as part of a supported process. With Stellco Homes, a custom build home makes building your dream home quicker, easier and also reduces the risk for you.

Custom build homes are a popular choice for people who want to be more involved in the design and construction of their home rather than leaving everything in the hands of a big developer. A custom build home starts with you working with one of our experienced Project Managers to create your own personalised floor plan and house design. With us to support you, you will choose the finishes, fixtures and fittings and specifications that will make your new home unique.

A home designed and created specifically for you which allows you to enhance many aspects of your life! It allows you to create a home that meets the needs of the whole family at a fixed price and timescale and removes all the hard work and frustration leaving you to enjoy the whole self-build experience. There are many benefits in custom building with us, some of which are noted below:
You will get the home that you want not the one someone else wants you to buy.
Makes self-building your dream home quicker, easier and also reduces the risk for you.
A choice of five detached plots for you to design and Stellco Homes to build your dream home to your very own specification, removing much of the stress and risk from the process. We believe "There are three responses to a piece of design - yes, no, and WOW! Wow is the one to aim for!" Milton Glaser
Our first-hand experience of building our own home means we understand how important it is to get things right for our customers and how much it means to them. Our attention to detail is outstanding in helping to create you a home that is personal and original. We know the questions to ask for you to make the right choices!
We help to create a home you can be truly proud of.


How
Our layouts of the individual plots are expertly designed to maximise the community aspect of your home. We will make it a desirable and safe environment for you and your family to live.
We will guide you through a step-by-step process.
You will be consulted throughout the project through your very own 'My Stellco Home' online portal.
Custom build with us is an exciting process and we aim to make it as stress free and memorable for you as possible. Your online portal will record photo updates of the build and explanations of what work is going on. The portal is a great place to find inspiration for your designs and keep in contact with us.

Property description
Grade II listed village house with annexe and extensive useful outbuildings.

Description

Chalk Farmhouse is a substantial former farmhouse situated in the centre of this popular well connected village just south of Cambridge. Grade II listed, the property is believed to date from the 16th Century with later additions and alterations and it includes extensive outbuildings. Of timber framed construction with lime rendered painted elevations under a plain tiled roof, the house has undergone some renovation works during the current owner’s tenure (of around 10 years) including replacement of the render to two elevations with new chestnut lathes and the insertion of sheep’s wool insulation.

The house has well proportioned accommodation arranged over two floors which extends to around 4557 sq ft and would benefit from a degree of modernisation but it retains that special period farmhouse feel with lots of character and space. On the ground floor there are three large reception rooms, a study, a farmhouse kitchen, large utility/boot room and a small garden room. Beneath part of the ground floor are reasonably large cellars which may have further potential (subject to appropriate permissions and Listed Building consent). At first floor level - accessed via two staircases - there are 7 bedrooms and two bath or shower rooms (one refitted in recent times).

In addition to the house there is a separate converted former granary which is currently let but has provided useful income from letting on Holiday Lettings (Trip Advisor). This is a first floor conversion with an open plan kitchen/living room/bedroom and a shower room.

The accommodation is shown in greater detail in the attached floor plans.

Outside

The property is approached from the street via the entrance to The George public house and a shared drive (shown shaded blue on the siteplan) passing adjacent to a weatherboarded barn leads into a large shingled courtyard.

The Granary is to the left, accessed via a short flight of stairs, and straight ahead is a long single storey range of brick slated outbuildings divided into 7 stores which may offer potential for conversion (subject to any necessary consents). Please note these were reroofed in 2012. On the other side of the courtyard is a horse-shoe shaped range of brick and flint buildings currently converted to office use and let as two units. These spaces could be used by the owner of Chalk Farmhouse or alternatively, continue to be let out as a potential source of income. The layouts of the buildings are also shown in the attached floor plans.

To either side of the farmhouse are areas of garden, laid to lawn with mature trees and sheltered from the road by extensive planting.

In all 0.58 of an acre

Location

Babraham is a sought-after small, pretty village 4.1 miles south east of the Cambridge city boundary. The village is conveniently situated for nearby business and science parks including the Addenbrookes Biomedical campus, Babraham Institute, Granta Park, The Genome Campus and Little Chesterford research park. There are good local facilities in the village including a public house, The George and a well regarded Primary School.

Mainline rail services into Cambridge & London’s Liverpool Street are available from nearby Whittlesford Station.

Local shopping is available in nearby Sawston. Cambridge offers comprehensive shopping schooling recreational and cultural facilities along with its world renowned University Colleges.

The A11, which leads south to the M11 (J9a) is just outside the village and via the A505 to Junction 10 which leads north to the A14 and then onward to the A1 M1 & M6 to the north and north west.

Stansted Airport is approximately 22 miles south via the M11 (J8).

London is approximately 56 miles to the south.

Square Footage: 4,557 sq ft


Acreage: 0.58 Acres

Property description
New Farm is a spacious detached farmhouse which has undergone an extensive internal refurbishment with superb attention to detail and wonderful character throughout. Fantastic spacious rooms, wooden floors and beautiful, ornate fireplaces are just a few of the noteworthy features. The accommodation is split over 3 floors with the top floor acting as a 6th bedroom cum study with considerable storage beyond. The formal reception rooms are of fantastic proportions with lovely views across the paddocks beyond. The layout flows conveniently from the large breakfasting kitchen, “the hub”, through to the formal reception rooms. The first floor is made up of generous bedroom suites, again with many benefitting from the wonderful views across the paddocks and countryside.

Haddenham is a popular village situated approximately 7 miles South-West of the Cathedral City of Ely and approximately 16 miles from Cambridge. Haddenham has a range of day to day amenities and facilities including primary school, post office, day-to-day shop, chemist, doctor’s surgery, butchers, take-away restaurant and 2 public houses. There is a full range of shopping, schooling and sporting facilities in Ely with a mainline rail service to Cambridge and London.

Outbuildings

New Farm is currently running as a highly successful stud farm with facilities for up to five breeding mares. The current set up is designed to allow the mares to run as a herd with large, open, steel portal frame barns as well as individual stabling and veterinary facilities on site.
The outbuildings are listed as follows:
Barn 1: Large 6 bay steel portal framed barn with block and cladding. This barn has a large viewing area and feed store adjoining.
Barn 2: Two foaling boxes and steel portal framed building for post delivery progression and up to two mares and foals can be accommodated in this barn
Barn 3: Steel portal frame barn
Barn 4: 3 foaling boxes and veterinary room complete with crush and wash basins.

Further outbuildings include log store, garden store and double garage.

Gardens & Grounds
Due to the current working capacity of the property the land has been subdivided into a series of paddocks and holding areas. In all there is a total of 22.39 acres, made up of 7 paddocks, the largest of which is 8 acres, a further paddock of 4.5 acres and five smaller paddocks. In addition to the equine facilities there is an area of formal garden to the front of the property currently laid to lawn and a lovely south facing sun terrace.
